intro: Metastelma warmingii, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
